Intervention.evidence: To compare two surgical strategies for myocardial revascularization: one by a minimally invasive direct coronary artery bypass (MIDCAB) and the other by a conventional full sternotomy coronary artery bypass grafting (CABG).

Objective.evidence: Objective: To compare two surgical strategies for myocardial revascularization: one by a minimally invasive direct coronary artery bypass (MIDCAB) and the other by a conventional full sternotomy coronary artery bypass grafting (CABG).

Number_Randomised.evidence: Of 1915 patients, 1752 underwent conventional CABG utilizing a single internal thoracic artery (ITA) graft and 163 underwent a MIDCAB procedure.

Result_Outcome.evidence: the hazard ratio was 0.429 (95%CI 0.321–0.574, p < 0.001) for the whole cohort and 0.559 (95%CI: 0.376–0.831, p = 0.004), for the matched cohort.
